Name: Stalker
Summary: Stalker uses Gear tokens for strength and provides [Light] at [III].

Name: Pylorian
Summary: [Arcane Spell] specialist.

Name: Stormhand
Summary: [Edged Weapon] specialist.

Name: Brimstone
Summary: The more [Light] you have, the more powerful Brimstone gets.

Name: Ehrlingal
Summary: Ehrlingal provides [Light] at [II] and is a [Dagger] specialist.

Name: Felin
Summary: Felin can shapeshift her form, depending on the situation.

Name: Gendarme
Summary: Gendarme uses secret Dwarven magic to empower your [Weapons].

Name: Baharan
Summary: Baharan uses strange magics, allowing you to discard cards for bonuses.

Name: Markennan
Summary: [Blunt Weapon] specialist.

Name: Darkrend
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: Using forbidden blood magic, Darkrend inflicts [Wound] to power her attacks.

Name: Grimwolf
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: Risen to complete his mission, Grimwolf bleeds ([Wound]) to power himself.

Name: Honormain
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Jadress
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: [Bow Weapon] specialist.

Name: Moonblades
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Stormskull
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Aird
Summary: Aird uses your opponents’ strengths against them.

Name: Arcanian
Summary: Arcanian's sorcery changes dice rolls. She also provides [Light] at [II].

Name: Dunardic
Summary: Once a Town Guard, Dunardic uses your [XP] as a resource.

Name: Terakian
Summary: [Potion] specialist.

Name: Veris
Summary: Veris has the ability to make [Weapons] glow bright.

Name: Graeme Crawford
Summary: This grizzled veteran may not like you, but he'll heal you. When the situation calls for it, he can imbue his attack with [Magic Attack].

Name: Khomros
Summary: Better at battling the [Aberrations] and [Plants] of the sewer, Khomros uses whatever [Weapons] he finds (discards from your deck).

Name: Ophialyn the Tracker
Summary: Ophialyn is the best hunter of [Beasts], [Fey], [Giants], [Golems], and [Humanoids]. She learns to track like a [Rogue] at [Level II].

Name: Runiva Highstone
Summary: Experienced at battling [Beasts] and [Giants], Runiva will light the path if she can find (discard from your deck) the right spell.

Name: Uvina the Delver
Summary: Uvina delves through (discards from) your deck, getting extra [Gear] for your next venture.

Name: Wiltran Proudmore
Summary: Wiltran brews [Potions] and focuses his efforts on healing your [Wound Cards] by discarding them straight out of your deck. He learns [Wizard]ly arts at [Level II].

Name: Breezy
Summary: A master of the elemental arts.

Name: Drulfal the Primordial
Summary: Drulfal is adept at both wielding and withstanding the elements.

Name: Lefira
Summary: Lefira gets the most out of [Bread] tokens and [Edged Weapons]. She produces [Gold] at [Level II].

Name: Lilande
Summary: This elven bard learns the arts of the [Wizard] at [Level II] and the [Fighter] at [Level III]. Lilande’s tale is best if you have a [Side Quest] or [Prestige Class] to relate.

Name: Rugduhr Blackmane
Summary: Rugduhr maximizes his [Gear] while he hunts the one he once served.

Name: Samly Thrackson
Summary: Samly destroys the impurities and inefficiencies he finds in decks.

Name: Damilu Huskie
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Daramere’s Cloak
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Potion of Light
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Ring of Proficiency
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Bracers of Cleansing
Summary: [Village] or [Dungeon]: Discard 3 cards from your deck. Heal 1 [Wound Card] discarded or gain 1 [Light].

Name: Neverending Rope Spool
Summary: After this card is discarded from your deck, draw it if you have a [Rogue]. [Village] or [Dungeon]: Give 1 [Hero] the [Rogue] keyword and +1 to the values they have printed: [Physical Attack], [Magic Attack], [Skill], [Light], [Level], and [Gold]. Discard 1 card from your deck for each [Rogue] you now have.

Name: Studded Leather Shirt
Summary: +1 [Physical Attack] if this [Hero] is [Human] or wields a [Weapon]. You may resolve the [After Battle] from 1 Studded Leather Shirt per turn, or 2 per turn if this is a [Fighter]. [After Battle]: Take −1 [Wound] from Monsters this turn.

Name: Wand of Illumination
Summary: [Spoils]: If you have a [Cleric], [Wizard], or [Halfling], gain 1 [Lantern] token.

Name: Eternal Flame
Summary: You may only give this card’s +[Magic Attack] and +[Skill] boosts to a [Dwarf] or [Cleric].

Name: Ice Climbing Gear
Summary: This card’s [Skill] and [Light] values each have +1 when given to a [Halfling] or [Rogue]. Ignore [Alert] effects from Dungeon Rooms.

Name: Snow Trekking Tools
Summary: [Frostbite Wounds] you take are [Wounds] instead. [Dungeon]: Discard this card and another card to draw 1 card.

Name: Tent
Summary: You may ignore [After Battle] abilities from Dungeon Rooms. [Spoils]: You have +1 [HP]. You may only use [Spoils] from 1 Tent per turn.

Name: Death Pact
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Mirror Image
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Tempest
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: True Seeing
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Blizzard
Summary: 1 [Magic Attack] for each of your [Frostbite Wounds]. [Dungeon]: +2 [Magic Attack]. Take 1 [Frostbite Wound].

Name: Cone of Cold
Summary: When you gain this card, roll [1d6]. On a 4+, destroy 1 of your cards. [Magic Attack] equal to your highest [Wizard]’s [Level]+1.

Name: Create Fire
Summary: [Bread] tokens used to boost [Heroes]’ [Skill] also give the [Hero] +1 [Physical Attack]. [Bread] tokens used for [Gold] produce +1 [Gold].

Name: Inner Fire
Summary: Monster [Before Battle] are [After Battle] instead for you. This card has 1 [Light] if you have a [Cleric] or [Wizard], or 2 [Light] if you have 1 [Hero] with both keywords.

Name: Acid Burst
Summary: Reduce the [Defense] of the Monster you battle this turn by your highest [Wizard]’s [Level], or [Level]+1 if battling an [Aberration], [Golem], or [Humanoid].

Name: Ascendance
Summary: -[Cost] equal to the total [Level] of all [Clerics] and [Wizards] you have. [Village] or [Spoils]: Level up 1 [Hero], paying [XP].

Name: Cure Disease
Summary: [Village] or [Dungeon]: Heal 1 [Wound]. If it was a [Disease], also heal 1 [Wound]. You may give 1 [Cleric] +[Magic Attack] equal to the [Cleric]’s [Level].

Name: Haste
Summary: After this card is discarded from your deck, give 1 [Hero] +1 [Physical Attack] and +1 [Skill]. [Dungeon]: Give your [Heroes] and [Heroes] in your Party +1 [Physical Attack] and +1 [Skill]. When discarding cards from your deck this turn, discard +1 card.

Name: Broadsword
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Crossbow
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Flail
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Two-Handed Sword
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Fire Rod
Summary: −5 [Skill] for [Clerics] and [Wizards], or −3 [Skill] for [Rogues] and [Humans]. [Spoils]: Gain 1 [Lantern] token.

Name: Flaming Hammer
Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Dwarves] and [Orcs].

Name: Frost Bow
Summary: −2 [Skill] for, and +1 [Magic Attack] against, [Celestials], [Demons], [Elementals], and [Elves].

Name: Mechanical Harpoon
Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Halflings] and [Rogues]. [Spoils]: If this is wielded by a [Hero] with 6+ [Skill], gain 1 [Bread] token.

Name: Bastard Sword
Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Humans]. [Spoils]: If this is wielded by a [Fighter], level it up, paying [XP].

Name: Battlepick
Summary: After this card is discarded from your deck, you may give it to a [Hero] with 5+ [Skill] to wield. [Dungeon]: Discard 2 cards from your deck.

Name: Cleaner’s Net
Summary: You may ignore [Alert] effects from [Plants], [Swarms], and [Vermin]. They have −1 [Defense] and −1 to their [Wound] value against you. [Spoils]: You may destroy this [Weapon].

Name: The Five Points
Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Dwarves] and [Tritons]. After this card is discarded (from anywhere, but not from the turn ending), gain 1 [Bread]. [Village] or [Dungeon]: If unwielded, discard this card.

Name: Elmoran
Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Name: Black Rock Bandits
Summary: They attack your Marketplace cards.

Name: Hobgoblin Brutes
Summary: They attack Heroes and their equipment.

Name: Spider Terrors
Summary: They wound heavily ([Wound] and [Wound Card]) and are drawn to equipment.

Name: Woodland Sprites
Summary: They deal Festering Wounds ([Wound Card]).

Name: Corrupted Elves
Summary: Destroy your [XP] or suffer their wrath.

Name: Foundational Keepers
Summary: These Ogres attack as soon as they refill the Dungeon (but not at game setup).

Name: Corrupted Centaurs
Summary: They are each susceptible to a particular Class, but resilient against others.

Name: Treefolk
Summary: They are worth much more if you defeat them convincingly.

Name: Bog Zombies
Summary: They deal Festering Wounds ([Wound Card]).

Name: Chaos Lizards
Summary: They discard your cards based on the outcome of dice rolls.

Name: Moor Skeletons
Summary: They deal [Wound Card] and are resistant to [Physical Attack] and [Edged Weapons].

Name: Marsh Trolls
Summary: They have immunities to different cards.

Name: Swamp Spirits
Summary: They hunger for (attack) your [Heroes].

Name: Air Servitors
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: They tend to be vulnerable to [Magic Attack]

Name: Water Servitors
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: They move throughout the dungeon making it unpredictable.

Name: Earth Servitors
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: They are strong against [Physical Attack].

Name: Fire Servitors
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: They attack your [Skill] and Weapons.

Name: Divine Founders
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: They judge (attack) your Heroes harshly.

Name: Abyssal Founders
Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Summary: The chaotic nature of their dice rolls make them unpredicatble. [sic]

Name: Doomknights
Summary: They attack Heroes who try to move through their room.

Name: Gnoll Raiders
Summary: They destroy your Weapons and Gear.

Name: Minions of Chaos
Summary: They destroy your Heroes based on the outcome of dice rolls.

Name: Torments
Summary: They are strong against [Magic Attack].

Name: Ancient Wyrms
Summary: They like to snack on (attack) your Heroes.

Name: Ancient Protectors
Summary: They are immune to Heroes with low [Skill].

Name: Arctic Animals
Summary: Arctic Animals are well-adapted to stalking their chilled prey, attacking as you enter or leave the room.

Name: Abyssal Servants
Summary: Abyssal Servants chill your bones, reducing your [HP].

Name: Bloodfrost Clan
Summary: Unimpeded by the cold, the Bloodfrost Clan strikes hard and fast, both before and after battle.

Name: Tundra Wolf Pack
Summary: A Tundra Wolf Pack’s numbers and attacks are as fast as they are unpredictable, striking before and after battle. (This [Swarm] gains +[1d6] [Defense].)

Name: Frozen Natives
Summary: An ancient race of half-dog, half-humans, the Adlet attacks are devastatingly unpredictable.

Name: Ice Behemoths
Summary: The arctic wastes abount with high [Defense] behemoths who ask no questions.

Name: Drain Dwellers
Summary: They attack you when you try to move out of their room.

Name: Plague Rats
Summary: This swarm can number in dozens or hundreds, but it often brings disease. (This [Swarm] gains +[1d6] [Defense].)

Name: Ghoulish Scavengers
Summary: They use your diseases against you.

Name: Sewer Trogs
Summary: The Sewer Trogs are heavy wounders.

Name: Shapeless Spawns
Summary: These [Aberrations] of the deep grow stronger with your [Wound Cards].

Name: Waste Wyrms
Summary: Heavy wounders that deal both [Wound Cards] and [Wounds].
